meanings.definition: The process of breaking up into small pieces or fragments.
meanings.sent1: During the earthquake, the spallation of the old building caused debris to scatter everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The spallation of the rock was caused by the extreme heat and pressure.
meanings.sent3: The spallation of the pinata led to a shower of candies and toys.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was undergoing spallation, breaking into countless pieces after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The spallation of the glass sculpture created a dazzling display of shards on the floor.

meanings.definition: The act of spalling or chipping off.
meanings.sent1: The spallation of the paint on the wall revealed the old layers underneath.
meanings.sent2: The spallation of the bark on the tree was a sign of disease.
meanings.sent3: The spallation of the cookie from the edge of the plate made it an easy target for the hungry dog.
meanings.sent4: His patience finally reached its limit, and the spallation of his temper was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The spallation of the ice from the roof made a loud crashing sound in the quiet night.
